table.name: driver_power_unit_join
table.description: Define the default relationship between driver and power unit.

columns.name: DRIVER_GID
columns.description: The driver assigned to the power unit.

columns.name: POWER_UNIT_GID
columns.description: The power unit assigned to the driver.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: The effective date for this Driver and Power Unit union.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: The expiration date for this Driver and Power Unit union.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: CALENDAR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the calendar that determines the day and times when the power unit can be used with the driver. For example, if you select a calendar for Monday through Friday, 8 a.m.-8 p.m., that power unit would be used with that driver Monday through Friday, 8 a.m.-8 p.m.. On a different driver you could then select a time of Monday through Friday, 8 p.m. -8 a.m., as well as on any time on Saturday and Sunday, and assign the same power unit to a different driver. Only calendars with an activity of Driver Work will be considered for overlap when other drivers share the same power unit. Validation checks against other calendars for duplicate assignments when you save. By establishing power unit availability to multiple drivers through the use of a calendar, you are defining 'slip seating'.
